meanings.definition: To establish territorial boundaries or claim ownership over a specific area.
meanings.sent1: The cat was territorializing its favorite spot on the couch by leaving its scent there.
meanings.sent2: The wolves were territorializing the forest by howling to warn intruders.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels were territorializing the park, making sure no other animals invaded their space.
meanings.sent4: The farmer was territorializing his land, fencing it off to protect it from trespassers.
meanings.sent5: The birds were territorializing the bird feeder, chasing away any other birds that came near.

meanings.definition: The act of marking or defending a territory.
meanings.sent1: The territorializing of the dog was evident as it barked at anyone approaching its yard.
meanings.sent2: The territorializing of the lions was fierce as they roared to protect their pride.
meanings.sent3: The territorializing of the bees was comical as they buzzed around guarding their hive.
meanings.sent4: The territorializing of the security guard was strict as he patrolled the premises.
meanings.sent5: The territorializing of the children over the playground equipment led to arguments and disputes.

meanings.definition: The process of transforming a space into a territory.
meanings.sent1: The territorializing of the garden began with planting flowers to make it their own.
meanings.sent2: The territorializing of the ants was seen as they built intricate tunnels in the dirt.
meanings.sent3: The territorializing of the students over the classroom desks was amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The territorializing of the artist turned the blank canvas into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The territorializing of the campers turned the campsite into a cozy home away from home.
